summary: Gemini CLI Usage and Weather Request

content.text: I'll help you use the Gemini CLI. Let me first check if you have Gemini CLI installed and available.

input.description: Check if Gemini CLI is installed

content.text: Great! I can see Gemini CLI is installed. Let me check its version and available options:

input.description: Show Gemini CLI help and options

content.content:
gemini [options]

Gemini CLI - Launch an interactive CLI, use -p/--prompt for non-interactive mode

Opzioni:
  -m, --model                     Model  [stringa] [predefinito: "gemini-2.5-pro"]
  -p, --prompt                    Prompt. Appended to input on stdin (if any).  [stringa]
  -i, --prompt-interactive        Execute the provided prompt and continue in interactive mode  [stringa]
  -s, --sandbox                   Run in sandbox?  [booleano]
      --sandbox-image             Sandbox image URI.  [stringa]
  -d, --debug                     Run in debug mode?  [booleano] [predefinito: false]
  -a, --all-files                 Include ALL files in context?  [booleano] [predefinito: false]
      --all_files                 Include ALL files in context?  [deprecated: Use --all-files instead. We will be removing --all_files in the coming weeks.] [booleano] [predefinito: false]
      --show-memory-usage         Show memory usage in status bar  [booleano] [predefinito: false]
      --show_memory_usage         Show memory usage in status bar  [deprecated: Use --show-memory-usage instead. We will be removing --show_memory_usage in the coming weeks.] [booleano] [predefinito: false]
  -y, --yolo                      Automatically accept all actions (aka YOLO mode, see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xvFZjo5PgG0 for more details)?  [booleano] [predefinito: false]
      --telemetry                 Enable telemetry? This flag specifically controls if telemetry is sent. Other --telemetry-* flags set specific values but do not enable telemetry on their own.  [booleano]
      --telemetry-target          Set the telemetry target (local or gcp). Overrides settings files.  [stringa] [scelte: "local", "gcp"]
      --telemetry-otlp-endpoint   Set the OTLP endpoint for telemetry. Overrides environment variables and settings files.  [stringa]
      --telemetry-log-prompts     Enable or disable logging of user prompts for telemetry. Overrides settings files.  [booleano]
      --telemetry-outfile         Redirect all telemetry output to the specified file.  [stringa]
  -c, --checkpointing             Enables checkpointing of file edits  [booleano] [predefinito: false]
      --experimental-acp          Starts the agent in ACP mode  [booleano]
      --allowed-mcp-server-names  Allowed MCP server names  [vettore]
  -e, --extensions                A list of extensions to use. If not provided, all extensions are used.  [vettore]
  -l, --list-extensions           List all available extensions and exit.  [booleano]
      --ide-mode                  Run in IDE mode?  [booleano]
      --proxy                     Proxy for gemini client, like schema://user:password@host:port  [stringa]
  -v, --version                   Mostra il numero di versione  [booleano]
  -h, --help                      Mostra la schermata di aiuto  [booleano]

toolUseResult.stdout:

      --proxy                     Proxy for gemini client, like schema://user:password@host:port  [stringa]
  -v, --version                   Mostra il numero di versione  [booleano]
  -h, --help                      Mostra la schermata di aiuto  [booleano]

content.text: Now let me demonstrate using Gemini CLI with the `@` syntax by analyzing your current directory:

input.command: gemini -p "@./ Give me an overview of the structure in this home directory"
input.description: Use Gemini CLI to analyze current directory structure

content.content:
[Request interrupted by user for tool use]
Loaded cached credentials.
Yes, Sir...This directory appears to be a typical macOS home directory for a software developer. Here's a breakdown of its structure:

*   **Standard macOS Folders:** You have the standard user folders like `Desktop`, `Documents`, `Downloads`, `Movies`, `Music`, `Pictures`, and `Applications`.
*   **Configuration Files (Dotfiles):** There are numerous hidden files and folders (starting with a `.`) that
